notes: Learning rate ~20%. IV corrects simultaneous equations bias. Canonical cite.
Learning rate ~3.4% at firm-technology node. Much lower than industry lore.
Learning rate ~4.7% allowing within-firm spillovers across nodes.
Learning rate ~8% with cross-country spillovers. Spillovers via fabless clients.
INFLATED by: (a) simultaneous equations bias, (b) measurement error in early cumulative production. Chow tests reject stability at all breakpoints (F=4.2-41.1). Not used as baseline.
Plausible — close to Irwin & Klenow IV estimate.
Implausibly high — likely driven by measurement error in cumulative production estimates.
66% of technologies show structural breaks in learning rates. Past learning rates not good predictors of future rates.
